intro: Tecomaria nyassae, commonly known as the African rose or blue gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep blue. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Tecomaria nyassae thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
